Module entities
Package entities

Class Index

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.Index
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Index
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Index contains the information about a particular index in the course. Each course has a list of indices with different lesson timings per index. Class Attributes: -> CLASS_SIZE: int, which specifies the class size for each index, or how many students can be enrolled in one index. This value is a constant shared between all instances. -> indexCode: String, which is a unique ID that can be used to identify a particular index within a course. Example: 10110 -> groupName: String, which is a name given to the index. Example : SS3 -> vacancy: int, which stores the number of vacancies remaining in this particular index instance. When the index is created vacancy = CLASS_SIZE -> waitList : Queue(String), which stores a list of student ID's that are currently in the waitList, waiting to get registered to the index. -> enrolled : ArrayList(String), which stores a list of student ID's that are currently regsitered to the course. -> lessons : ArrayList, which is a list of lessons and its timings for this index instance.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Index

        public Index​(java.lang.String indexCode,
             java.lang.String groupName)
        Class constructor which is used to create an index for a course.
        Parameters:
        indexCode - , the unique identification string for an index within a course. A course cannot have duplicate indices.
        groupName - , A name given to the index. The waitList, enrolled, and lesson list are also initialized in the constructor to empty lists.

      • addLesson

        public boolean addLesson​(java.lang.String lessonType,
                         java.lang.String venue,
                         WorkingHours timings)
        addLesson() can be used to add a new lesson to the index. The function also imposes certain constraints on adding lessons within the same index. It creates a new lesson for the index using the parameters passed to it.
        Parameters:
        lessonType - , which is the type of lesson being added to the index (lecture/lab/tutorial etc.). An index can only have a certain number of each type of course, so the number of lessons of each type cannot grow without bound. This attribute can only hold certain values for lesson types that exist. Example : Tutorial has to be specified as "tut" Lab has to be specified as "lab" Lecture has to be specified as "lec" When new lesson types are added this function can be extended by adding another switch case for the new lesson type.
        venue - , which is the location where the lesson will occur.
        timings - , which is the time during which the lesson will occur. Two lessons within an index cannot occur at the same time.
        Returns:
        true, if the lesson was added successfully without any conflicts. false, if the lesson was not added successfully. This could be due to time conflicts, or because there the limit for this type of lesson has been reached.

      • deleteLesson

        public Lesson deleteLesson​(java.lang.String lessonType,
                           int day)
        deleteLesson() can be used to remove a lesson from an index. The lesson can be uniquely identified by its lesson type, and the day on which it occurs. Since the same lesson cannot occur twice on the same day.
        Parameters:
        lessonType - , which is the type of lesson being deleted. Example : lec, tut, lab etc.
        day - , which is the day number on which the lesson occurs. Example : day 2 corresponds to Monday, the second day of the week.
        Returns:
        A Lesson instance, which can be used to identify the lesson that is deleted. If the function returns null, it indicates that the lesson to be deleted does not exist.

      • registerStudent

        public boolean registerStudent​(java.lang.String studID)
        The registerStudent() function can be used to enroll a student to a course index. The index can only hold a number of students equal to the CLASS_SIZE. When this limit is exceeded, students that try to enroll are added to a queue waitList. Students on the waitlist are automatically enrolled to the course in a FCFS fashion when a student who is enrolled drops the course.
        Parameters:
        studID - , the student ID of the student trying to register to the course.
        Returns:
        true if the student has successfully registered to the course. false if the student failed to enroll to the course and was added to the waitlist. It also returns false if the student ID passed is a null value. As students are enrolled to the course, the course vacancies are also updated.

      • addStudentToWaitList

        public boolean addStudentToWaitList​(java.lang.String studID)
        addStudentToWaitList() is a private class function that is used to place a student at the end of the waitlist. It is a private method that is called by the registerStudent() function, when the index has no more vacancies when a student attempts to enroll to the index.
        Parameters:
        studID - , which is the ID of the student that failed to register and needs to be added to the waitList.
        Returns:
        true, if the student was added to the waitList successfully. False, if the student already exists in the waitList or if the student ID passed is invalid.

      • removeStudentFromWaitList

        public boolean removeStudentFromWaitList​(java.lang.String studID)
        The removeStudentFromWaitList() function can be used to remove a student from the waitList queue, given that the student exists in the queue. It is a private function that is called by the deregisterStudent() function when a student tries to deregister from the index. If the student does not exist in the enrolled list, the waitList is checked to see if the student is in the waitList.
        Parameters:
        studID - , which is the ID of the student trying to deregister from the course
        Returns:
        the student ID of the student that was removed from the waitList. Returns null if the student did not exist in the waitList.

      • printWaitList

        public void printWaitList()
        A function used to print the waitList of students.

      • deregisterStudent

        public boolean deregisterStudent​(java.lang.String studID)
        deregisterStudent() can be used to deregister a student from the index, given that the student exists in the enrolled list or the waitlist. When a student is removed from the enrolled list, the student at the front of the waitList queue is registered to the course.
        Parameters:
        studID - , the student ID of the student being deregistered.
        Returns:
        true if the student was found in the enrolled list and was removed successfully. If the student if not found in the enrolled list, the function returns false and two cases can occur. 1. The waitList is searched to find the student, and if the student is found the student is removed from the waitlist. 2. The waitList is searched and the student is not found in the waitList, and false is returned. The index vacancies are updated accordingly when the students are added and removed from the enrolled list and waitList.

      • findStudentEnrolled

        public java.lang.String findStudentEnrolled​(java.lang.String studID)
        findStudentEnrolled is a function that is primarily used to check if a student exists in the enrolled list. It is a private method that is called by other functions in the class for error handling purposes.
        Parameters:
        studID - , the student ID of the student being searched for in the enrolled list.
        Returns:
        the studentID of the student if the student is found in the list.

      • findStudentPosInEnrolled

        public int findStudentPosInEnrolled​(java.lang.String studID)
        findStudentPosInEnrolled() is a function that is primarily used to check if a student exists in the enrolled list. It is used to find the position of the enrolled student in the arrayList, in case the student needs to be removed from the list.
        Parameters:
        studID - , the student ID of the student being searched for in the enrolled list.
        Returns:
        the positon of the student in the arraylist of enrolled students. Returns -1 if the student does not exist in the arrayList.

      • findStudentInWaitList

        public java.lang.String findStudentInWaitList​(java.lang.String studID)
        findStudentEnrolled is a function that is primarily used to check if a student exists in the waitList. It is a private method that is called by other functions in the class for error handling purposes.
        Parameters:
        studID - , the student ID of the student being searched for in the waitList.
        Returns:
        the studentID of the student if the student is found in the waitList.

      • findStudentPosInWaitList

        public int findStudentPosInWaitList​(java.lang.String studID)
        findStudentPosInEnrolled() is a function that is primarily used to check if a student exists in the waitList. It is used to find the position of the enrolled student in the queue, in case the student needs to be removed from the list.
        Parameters:
        studID - , the student ID of the student being searched for in the waitList.
        Returns:
        the positon of the student in the queue of waitListed students. Returns -1 if the student does not exist in the queue.

      • countLessonsOfType

        public int countLessonsOfType​(java.lang.String lessonType)
        countLessonsOfType() is used to count the number of lessons of each type in the index. It is primarily used to check for errors when adding new lessons, and to check if a certain lesson threshold is being exceeded.
        Parameters:
        lessonType - , which is the type of lesson that needs to be counted.
        Returns:
        an integer which indicates the number of lessons of the specified type currently in the index.
